sections.heading: What is だ (da)?
sections.content:
だ (da) is the plain/casual form of the copula, equivalent to です in casual speech. It means "is/am/are" and is used in informal situations, writing, and as the dictionary form of the copula.

A は B だ "A is B" 私は学生だ "I am a student"

children.heading: With Nouns
children.content: これは本だ "This is a book" 彼は先生だ "He is a teacher" 私は日本人だ "I am Japanese" 今日は月曜日だ "Today is Monday"

children.heading: With Na-adjectives
children.content: この部屋は静かだ "This room is quiet" 京都はきれいだ "Kyoto is beautiful" 日本語は便利だ "Japanese is convenient" 彼は親切だ "He is kind"

children.heading: Casual Situations
children.content:
Use with friends, family, and close acquaintances.

友達: あれは何だ？ "What's that?" 自分: それは本だ "That's a book"

children.heading: Written Language
children.content:
Common in newspapers, novels, and academic writing.

富士山は日本で一番高い山だ "Mt. Fuji is Japan's tallest mountain" これは重要な問題だ "This is an important problem"

children.heading: Inner Thoughts
children.content:
Used when expressing your own thoughts.

今日は暑いな。大変だ "It's hot today. This is tough" これは難しいな "This is difficult"

children.heading: Quotations and Reports
children.content: 彼は学生だと言った "He said he's a student" これは本当だと思う "I think this is true"

children.heading: だ + か = か (without だ)
children.content:
In questions, だ is usually dropped before か in casual speech.

学生か？ "Are you a student?" 日本人か？ "Are you Japanese?" 本当か？ "Is it true?"

Note: だか sounds unnatural. Use just か instead.

children.heading: Rising Intonation
children.content:
Questions can be formed with rising intonation alone.

学生？↗ "A student?" 本当？↗ "Really?" 明日？↗ "Tomorrow?"

children.heading: じゃない (janai)
children.content:
The casual negative of だ is じゃない.

学生じゃない "I'm not a student" 本じゃない "It's not a book" 本当じゃない "It's not true" 簡単じゃない "It's not easy"

children.heading: ではない (dewa nai)
children.content:
More formal written negative form.

これは本ではない "This is not a book" 簡単ではない "It's not simple"

Usage difference:

じゃない: Spoken, casual ではない: Written, formal

children.heading: Politeness Level
children.content: Polite (です): 学生です Plain (だ): 学生だ "I am a student" Polite (です): 日本人です Plain (だ): 日本人だ "I am Japanese"

children.heading: Question Forms
children.content: Polite: 学生ですか？ Plain: 学生（だ）？ / 学生か？ "Are you a student?" Polite: 本当ですか？ Plain: 本当（だ）？ / 本当か？ "Really?"

children.heading: Negative Forms
children.content: Polite: 学生じゃないです / 学生ではありません Plain: 学生じゃない / 学生ではない "I'm not a student"

children.heading: ～だから (because)
children.content: 学生だから、お金がない "Because I'm a student, I don't have money" 忙しいんだから "It's because I'm busy" 日本人だから、日本語が話せる "Because I'm Japanese, I can speak Japanese"

children.heading: ～だけど (but)
children.content: 学生だけど、働いている "I'm a student, but I'm working" 簡単だけど、面白い "It's simple, but interesting"

children.heading: ～だと思う (I think)
children.content: 彼は学生だと思う "I think he's a student" 本当だと思う "I think it's true" 便利だと思う "I think it's convenient"

children.heading: ～だって (quotation/emphasis)
children.content: 彼は学生だって "He says he's a student / I heard he's a student" 本当だって！ "It's true (I'm telling you)!"

children.heading: だろう (probably)
children.content:
Presumptive form of だ.

学生だろう "He's probably a student" 本当だろう "It's probably true" 明日だろう "It's probably tomorrow"

children.heading: ～だった (past)
children.content:
Past tense of だ.

学生だった "I was a student" 昨日だった "It was yesterday" きれいだった "It was beautiful"

children.heading: ～だったら (conditional)
children.content: 学生だったら、割引がある "If you're a student, there's a discount" 本当だったら、すごい "If it's true, that's amazing"

children.heading: Before な (na for noun modification)
children.content: 学生だった人 "A person who was a student" 有名な人 "A famous person"

children.heading: Before の (nominalizer)
children.content: 学生なのだ → 学生なんだ "The thing is, I'm a student" 大変なのだ → 大変なんだ "The thing is, it's tough"

children.heading: Example 1: Casual Chat
children.content: A: これ、何？ "What's this?" B: 辞書だよ "It's a dictionary" A: 誰の？ "Whose?" B: 田中のだ "It's Tanaka's"

children.heading: Example 2: Confirmation
children.content: A: 明日、休みだよね？ "Tomorrow's a day off, right?" B: うん、休みだ "Yeah, it's a day off" A: 本当？ "Really?" B: 本当だって！ "It's true!"

children.heading: Example 3: Explanation
children.content: A: どうして来なかったの？ "Why didn't you come?" B: 忙しかったんだ "I was busy (that's why)" A: 仕事？ "Work?" B: そう、仕事だった "Yeah, it was work"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using だ in polite contexts
children.content: Wrong (to strangers/superiors): 学生だ ❌ Right: 学生です ✓ "I am a student"

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using だか in questions
children.content: Unnatural: 学生だか？ ❌ Natural: 学生？/ 学生か？ ✓ "Are you a student?"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Using だ after i-adjectives
children.content: Wrong: 大きいだ ❌ Right: 大きい ✓ "It's big" Note: I-adjectives don't need だ

children.heading: Mistake 4: Mixing politeness levels
children.content: Inconsistent: 私は学生だ。でも、毎日働いています ⚠️ Better: 私は学生だ。でも、毎日働いている ✓ Or: 私は学生です。でも、毎日働いています ✓

sections.heading: Gender Associations
sections.content: While だ itself is gender-neutral, it's often associated with masculine speech when used in casual conversation. Women might use more です or だわ variations.

children.heading: Neutral/Masculine
children.content: これは本だ "This is a book" 面白いな "This is interesting"

children.heading: Feminine variations
children.content:
これは本だわ "This is a book" 面白いわね "This is interesting"

Note: These distinctions are becoming less strict in modern Japanese.

children.heading: Newspapers
children.content: 今日は晴れだ "Today is sunny" 事故の原因は不明だ "The cause of the accident is unknown"

children.heading: Novels/Narratives
children.content: 彼は学生だった "He was a student" それは本当のことだ "That's the truth"

children.heading: Academic Writing
children.content: これは重要な問題だ "This is an important problem" その理由は明らかだ "The reason is clear"

children.heading: だよ (emphasis)
children.content: 本当だよ "It's true (I'm telling you)" 学生だよ "I'm a student (you know)"

children.heading: だね (agreement)
children.content: そうだね "That's right, isn't it" 便利だね "It's convenient, isn't it"

children.heading: だな (contemplative)
children.content: 難しいな "This is difficult (hmm)" そうだな "That's right (let me think)"

children.heading: だぞ (strong emphasis - masculine)
children.content: 本当だぞ "It's really true!" 危ないぞ "It's dangerous!"

sections.heading: Practice Sentences
sections.content: これは私のだ "This is mine" 彼は学生だ "He's a student" それは本当だ "That's true" 簡単じゃない "It's not easy" 昨日は月曜日だった "Yesterday was Monday" たぶん明日だろう "It's probably tomorrow" 学生だから、忙しい "Because I'm a student, I'm busy" 本だけど、面白くない "It's a book, but it's not interesting" 誰のペンだ？ "Whose pen is this?" どこだ？ "Where is it?"
